intro: Hieracium jurassicum subsp. prenanthopsis, commonly known as the Jurassic hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and flowering pattern compared to other members of the Hieracium genus.
